Posts.Content: Hi  Have just remembered I was prescribed a mouth moisturiser called Xerotin when I was having docetaxol,  don't think I actually used it but I did use difflam mouthwash before meals that helped the soreness.      Good luck    SB xxxx
Posts.Title: Docetaxal and dry throat/mouth

Posts.Content: Hi Pa Sorry to hear you are going through chemo, not nice, I had very bad indigestion and acid reflux with last lot of chemo a year ago, Was prescribed omeprazole capsules which I take twice a day before meals , also prescribed gaviscon advanced, which is more effective than regular gaviscon Your GP should be able to help you Also I got really constipated on chemo and needed lactulose or laxido Hope this helps ,take care. SB xxxxx
Posts.Title: Chronic indigestion

Posts.Content: Hi Angie70 my experience with sore mouth with tax sounds similar to yours, I was prescribed difflam mouth wash to use before meals, it soothes and numbs your mouth and prevents infection. Eat what you can Spicey foods were out for me. The nurses recommended pineapple, but I found it too acidy , all the best xxx

Posts.Content: Hi,  I went through same chemo in 2009,  i understand how you feel, and agree with everything ermoinig wrote, but wasn't able to make a lot of changes to my diet, and what I was eating was quite healthy. Difflam mouthwash helped with the sore mouth, and just sheer will power, and sometimes just a belief that the doctors know the effect of the chemo so tell them everything. Ring the GP for extra support or the breast care nurse, talk to friends and family about how you are feeling. Lots of hugs. SB xxx
Posts.Title: Struggling after forth chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda, I found radio therapy easier to bear than chemo, although I finished chemo in august 2009 then had a mastectomy and lymph node clearance in September followed by radiotherapy to the scar for a month in November and December The machines are a bit intimidating but you soon get used to the routine and hopefully it will all go to plan for you. Good luck  SB xxxx George and Jackie thanks for the info on herceptin,  currently on cycle 21 and struggling a bit xxx
